title: Extended families of Allied Forces translators arrive in Canada | CTV News
text: Hundreds of refugees touched down in Calgary Friday morning, leaving a life under the Taliban behind them. They were received at the airport by the Calgary Catholic Immigration Society. Of the more than 300 refugees, 44 will call Calgary home. The rest will carry on to other parts of Canada. Among them are extended family members of those who worked as translators in Afghanistan for the Allied Forces, and fled once the Taliban returned to power in 2021. That made for some emotional family reunions at the Calgary International Airport. And as a sign of hope and respect on International Women’s Day, and a promise of a new beginning, the women in the group were each presented a single red rose.
